articles.headline: Baramati crash preliminary report puts visibility in focus
articles.summary: An investigation into the crash that killed Ajit Pawar found visibility was 3,000 metres, below the legal 5,000-metre minimum for visual flight. The report also identified systemic flaws including the lack of formal meteorological facilities at Baramati airfield.

articles.headline: Unidentified man found murdered in Bengaluru rented house
articles.summary: Bengaluru police discovered the decomposed body of an unidentified man tied and stabbed inside a house in Vijaya Lakshmi Layout. The tenants, who identified themselves as Mohan Krishna and Urvashi, have gone missing.

articles.headline: Five migrant workers arrested with 30kg ganja in Kerala
articles.summary: Kerala police arrested five workers from West Bengal for allegedly possessing 30 kilograms of ganja at Puthencruz. The operation was carried out by the Narcotic Special Action Force and local police.

articles.headline: Elderly woman set on fire on witchcraft suspicion in Odisha
articles.summary: A 70-year-old woman was allegedly hacked and set ablaze by a relative who suspected her of practicing witchcraft in Mayurbhanj. The accused surrendered to the police shortly after the crime occurred.

articles.headline: Man arrested for killing minor boy in Jharkhand’s West Singhbhum
articles.summary: Police arrested a man for allegedly murdering a young boy after an attempted sexual exploitation. The victim was reportedly killed when he screamed during the attack in a local village.

articles.headline: Nearly 1,200 Indian medical students remain stranded in conflict-hit Iran
articles.summary: Student bodies have urged the Indian government to prepare an evacuation plan for approximately 1,200 students currently in Iran. Many students stayed back to appear for critical medical examinations scheduled for March 5.

articles.headline: Preliminary report flags SOP violations in crash involving Ajit Pawar’s aircraft
articles.summary: An initial investigation into the January 28 Learjet crash at Baramati has identified pilot non-adherence to standard procedures and low visibility. The crash resulted in the death of then Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar.

articles.headline: Karnataka village in panic as dozens of residents remain stuck in Iran
articles.summary: The village of Alipur in Chikkaballapur district is in distress as nearly 60 residents are currently in Iran for studies and pilgrimage. Local leaders are coordinating with the state government to ensure the safety of the stranded villagers.

articles.headline: Pro-Iran Protests Erupt in Kashmir Following US and Israel Attacks
articles.summary: Shia-dominated areas in Srinagar, Baramulla, and Budgam saw residents protesting against the military strikes on Iran. Demonstrators carried portraits of Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei and raised slogans in solidarity with the Iranian regime.

articles.headline: Rajasthan Renames Mount Abu to Abu Raj in Decolonisation Drive
articles.summary: Chief Minister Bhajan Lal Sharma announced in the state Assembly that Mount Abu will be renamed Abu Raj. Other historic cities like Kaman and Jahazpur have also been renamed to Kamvan and Yagyapur respectively to reflect local heritage.

articles.headline: Abandoned Macaque Monkey in Japan Becomes Global Symbol of Vulnerability
articles.summary: A monkey named Punch from Ichikawa City Zoo has become an internet sensation after being rejected by his pack. His story has driven a massive surge in sales for the specific IKEA plushie he uses for emotional support.

articles.headline: Harsh summer with more heatwaves ahead, says IMD
articles.summary: The India Meteorological Department predicts above-normal temperatures across most of the country from March to May 2026. East, central, and northwest India are expected to face an increased number of heatwave days during this period.

articles.headline: Crude oil leak at Barmer oilfields affects daily production
articles.summary: A leak from an oil well in Rajasthan's Barmer district has forced the shutdown of operations at the Aishwarya Wellpad. Officials are working to contain the spill, which surfaced on farmland and impacted local production.

articles.headline: Ancient trees offer clues to survival amid climate change
articles.summary: A study of thousand-year-old trees like the Giant Sequoia and Qilian Juniper reveals spectacular biological adaptations. These species provide critical data for understanding forest history and resilience against extreme environmental shifts.

articles.headline: Nine more cheetahs from Botswana arrive at Madhya Pradesh’s Kuno National Park
articles.summary: India's total cheetah population reached 48 following the arrival of six females and three males from Botswana on Saturday. The animals will undergo health screening and acclimatization before being released into the wild.

articles.headline: IMD forecasts above-normal heatwave days across India from March to May
articles.summary: The India Meteorological Department warned of an above-normal number of heatwave days for most parts of the country during the upcoming summer months. Rajasthan, Gujarat, and several southern states are expected to be most affected.

articles.headline: Kejriwal discharged from excise case, plans strategy meetings
articles.summary: Arvind Kejriwal was discharged from the CBI's excise policy case by a Delhi court. Following his release, the AAP convener held strategy meetings and announced a public rally at Jantar Mantar.

articles.headline: DMK to finalise election manifesto within next ten days
articles.summary: MP Kanimozhi announced that the DMK's election manifesto is in its final stages of preparation and will be submitted soon. The document will focus on the party's 'Dravidian model' of governance for the people.

articles.headline: Kerala releases Justice Koshy report on Christian community welfare
articles.summary: The Kerala government has made public the 364-page Justice JB Koshy Commission report detailing issues faced by Christians. It recommends additional reservations in education and employment based on population ratios.

articles.headline: Telangana CM cancels land allotment to Sharada Peetham
articles.summary: CM Revanth Reddy instructed officials to cancel the land allotment previously given to Sharada Peetham in Hyderabad. The land will return to the ownership of the city's water board.

articles.headline: Rohit Pawar questions Baramati crash report; Mahayuti dismisses claims
articles.summary: NCP(SP) leader Rohit Pawar raised doubts about the preliminary investigation into the jet crash involving Ajit Pawar. Mahayuti coalition leaders responded by saying the findings prove his earlier conspiracy theories were baseless.

articles.headline: BJP MP celebrates Holi in Uttarakhand ghost villages to curb migration
articles.summary: MP Anil Baluni participated in Holi celebrations in deserted villages of Pauri Garhwal to encourage migrants to reconnect with their roots. He also launched the 'Apna Vote Apne Gaon' campaign to register voters in native villages.

articles.headline: ACC clears empanelment of 41 IAS officers for secretary posts
articles.summary: The Appointments Committee of the Cabinet approved 41 senior IAS officers from the 1990-1995 batches for secretary-level positions. This move prepares the groundwork for major administrative appointments within the central government.

articles.headline: Rahul Gandhi urges tax exemption on disability pension for soldiers
articles.summary: In a letter to the Finance Minister, Rahul Gandhi argued that disability pensions for soldiers invalided out of service should be exempt from income tax. He claimed the current tax proposal is discriminatory against those injured in service.

articles.headline: Modi to visit Madurai temple and launch infrastructure projects
articles.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will offer prayers at the Subramanyaswamy Temple in Madurai on Sunday. He is also set to inaugurate and lay the foundation stones for projects worth over ₹2,700 crore in Tamil Nadu and Puducherry.

articles.headline: West Bengal voter count drops by 16 percent in final election roll
articles.summary: The Election Commission released the final voter list for West Bengal, deleting 63.7 lakh names and placing another 60 lakh under adjudication. Officials stated that many deleted entries were suspected illegal immigrants.

articles.headline: India calls for restraint and dialogue as West Asia conflict spirals
articles.summary: Foreign Minister S. Jaishankar spoke with counterparts in Iran and Israel to express deep concern over escalating military tensions. India emphasized the need for dialogue and the protection of its nine million citizens in the region.

articles.headline: Menaka Guruswamy nominated to Rajya Sabha as India’s first openly queer MP
articles.summary: The Trinamool Congress has nominated senior advocate Menaka Guruswamy for a seat in the Rajya Sabha. Guruswamy was a key legal figure in the battle to decriminalize Section 377 and homosexuality in India.

articles.headline: National Law University in Patiala recommends removal of Rajiv Gandhi name
articles.summary: The academic council of the university has passed a resolution to rename the institution simply as 'National Law University.' The move follows student protests and grievances related to the 1984 anti-Sikh violence.

articles.headline: BJP Ally UPPL to Contest Assam Assembly Elections Independently
articles.summary: The United People’s Party Liberal (UPPL) has announced it will field candidates in 21 seats without a coalition in the upcoming Assam polls. The party plans to contest 15 seats within the Bodoland Territorial Council region and six outside it.

articles.headline: Yogi Adityanath Secures Major Investment Proposals During Singapore and Japan Tour
articles.summary: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath's four-day overseas visit secured MoUs worth ₹1.5 lakh crore across manufacturing and infrastructure sectors. The tour is viewed as an effort to bolster his pro-development image ahead of state assembly elections.

articles.headline: Expelled Samajwadi Party MLAs Dismiss Rumors of Returning to Party
articles.summary: Three MLAs expelled from the Samajwadi Party in 2025 for cross-voting in Rajya Sabha elections have denied speculation of a return. In a joint statement, the legislators described the rumors as baseless and stated they remain focused on their constituents.

articles.headline: EU memo notes India's agri and food sensitivities in trade deal
articles.summary: An internal EU memo regarding the India-EU free trade agreement acknowledges high levels of protection for India's agricultural sector. The deal seeks to balance interests while helping India reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

articles.headline: Iran conflict risks oil price surge and rupee depreciation
articles.summary: Economists warn that a prolonged conflict in the Gulf could disrupt three million barrels of daily crude supply. This scenario would likely lead to higher fuel costs, increased insurance premiums, and pressure on the Indian rupee.

articles.headline: EPFO likely to recommend 8.2 to 8.25 percent interest rate for members
articles.summary: The Employees' Provident Fund Organisation’s Central Board of Trustees is expected to recommend an interest rate between 8.2% and 8.25% for its 23 crore members. The decision follows a year of tepid bond yields and high settlement claims.

articles.headline: Karnataka’s capital expenditure lags at 46 percent as revenue spending surges
articles.summary: Official data shows that Karnataka has spent only 46% of its allocated capital budget for the current fiscal year. Analysts expressed concern that borrowed funds are being used for revenue expenditure rather than asset creation.

articles.headline: Nirmala Sitharaman to review GST department overreach allegations after bank arrest
articles.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman stated she will look into allegations of GST authority overreach following the arrest of Fino Payments Bank CEO Rishi Gupta. The arrest was related to a 3,000 crore rupee tax evasion case.

articles.headline: Indian Refiners Prepare for Oil Price Spikes Amid West Asia Conflict
articles.summary: Indian oil companies are bracing for a price shock as tensions escalate in the Strait of Hormuz, a corridor for 40% of India's crude imports. Refiners are exploring alternative supply options to mitigate risks if energy facilities in the Gulf face further attacks.

articles.headline: India and Canada Set to Sign Decadel Uranium Supply Agreement
articles.summary: India and Canada are expected to finalize a 10-year contract for uranium ore concentrate supply during Canadian PM Mike Carney's visit to New Delhi. The deal marks a strategic reset in bilateral relations and builds on existing civil nuclear energy cooperation.

articles.headline: Global Pulse Trade Deals Threaten Survival of Regional Indian Varieties
articles.summary: Increasing imports of standardized pulses from Canada and the US are marginalizing unique local Indian varieties like Goa's merule. Experts warn that supermarket dominance and low support prices are discouraging farmers from planting diverse regional crops.

articles.headline: Modi inaugurates Micron semiconductor facility in Sanand, Gujarat
articles.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi opened the semiconductor assembly and packaging facility in Sanand, asserting India's role in the global manufacturing chain. He stated that microchips would be the primary regulator of the 21st century.

articles.headline: India activates contingency plans for oil supplies as Strait of Hormuz closes
articles.summary: Following the suspension of shipping through the Strait of Hormuz, Indian officials have activated plans to safeguard crude oil imports. Approximately 40% of India's oil imports transit through the passage currently at the center of the conflict.

articles.headline: Nineteen international flights cancelled at Bengaluru airport due to Gulf tensions
articles.summary: Flight operations at Kempegowda International Airport were disrupted with 19 services to West Asia cancelled over the weekend. Major carriers including IndiGo and Emirates suspended routes to Dubai and Abu Dhabi due to airspace restrictions.

articles.headline: Mattel faces backlash over redesign of historical American Girl dolls
articles.summary: The American Girl brand is facing criticism from collectors over the slimmer appearance of its new 'Modern Era' collection. Fans argue the teen-coded silhouettes dilute the brand's historically rooted and childlike charm.

articles.headline: Rolex records 14 billion dollars in sales to lead Swiss watch industry
articles.summary: Rolex dominated the luxury watch market in 2025, accounting for an estimated 33% of total Swiss watch sales. The brand achieved this milestone despite releasing fewer timepieces into the market during the year.

articles.headline: Indian Beauty Brands Focus on Micro-Problems to Capture D2C Market
articles.summary: New-age Indian beauty brands are targeting niche concerns like 'strawberry skin' and hair barrier repair to stand out in a crowded market. The D2C personal care sector is estimated to reach $4.5 billion by FY2025 as consumers seek ingredient-specific solutions.

articles.headline: Shipping Lines Reroute Vessels via Cape of Good Hope as Conflict Escalates
articles.summary: Global shipping major Maersk and other lines are avoiding the Red Sea and Persian Gulf due to missile attacks in the region. India's Directorate General of Shipping has issued advisories for vessels operating near the Strait of Hormuz.

articles.headline: IYC chief gets bail but sessions court stays relief
articles.summary: A Delhi court stayed the bail order of Indian Youth Congress chief Uday Bhanu Chib hours after a magistrate granted it. Chib was arrested for his role in protests during the AI Impact Summit.

articles.headline: Court releases Lamborghini involved in Kanpur crash on 3.3-crore bond
articles.summary: The luxury car owned by businessman KK Mishra was released under strict conditions after a high-profile road accident. The owner is prohibited from selling the vehicle or changing its appearance during the legal process.

articles.headline: Charge sheet filed in Lucknow University sexual exploitation case
articles.summary: Police filed a charge sheet against a former junior doctor for allegedly exploiting a female colleague under the pretext of marriage. The accused faces charges including rape, criminal intimidation, and forcing religious conversion.

articles.headline: CBI books senior IOFS officer in disproportionate assets case
articles.summary: The CBI registered a case against Amit Singh, a senior official at the Ordnance Equipment Factory, for possessing assets 72.9% beyond his known income. Searches were conducted across multiple cities, including Agra, Lucknow, and Kanpur.

articles.headline: Man arrested for raping nine-month-old niece in Madhya Pradesh
articles.summary: Police arrested a man in Damoh for allegedly raping his infant niece on Friday night. The victim was transferred to a medical college for treatment, and the accused has been charged under the BNS.

articles.headline: DMK functionary arrested for sexual assault and murder of toddler
articles.summary: A local DMK youth wing member was arrested in Krishnagiri for the alleged sexual assault and murder of a two-year-old girl. The accused had initially claimed the child suffered seizures before she was declared dead.

articles.headline: Haryana ACB arrests first government official in 590 crore bank scam
articles.summary: The Haryana Anti-Corruption Bureau arrested Naresh Kumar Bhutani, a superintendent, for his alleged involvement in a 590 crore rupee bank scam. He is accused of forming shell companies to siphon off government funds.

articles.headline: Karnataka High Court quashes land acquisition for private firm as mala fide
articles.summary: A division bench quashed the acquisition of 38 guntas of land by KIADB, describing the process as 'daylight dacoity' in favor of a private firm. The court ruled the acquisition violated procedures and favored 'land sharks.'

articles.headline: Bengaluru police shoot and injure rowdy murder suspect during arrest attempt
articles.summary: Police officers shot a murder suspect in the leg after he allegedly attacked them with a dagger during an arrest attempt. the suspect was wanted for the killing of a 24-year-old on SP Road.

articles.headline: Woman arrested for stabbing former boyfriend at his residence in Bengaluru
articles.summary: A 28-year-old woman was arrested after she allegedly stabbed her former boyfriend, a gym trainer, following a dispute. The victim is reported to be in stable condition after being rushed to a nearby hospital.

articles.headline: Principal and manager arrested after student alleges rape at Bengaluru school
articles.summary: Three individuals, including a school principal and manager, were arrested following allegations of sexual assault by an 11th-grade student. The victim’s parents approached police after the student revealed a pattern of abuse.

articles.headline: FIR registered against UP MLA’s son for thrashing toll plaza employee
articles.summary: Police in Agra have booked Suresh Chaudhary, the son of a BJP MLA, for criminal intimidation and assault. The incident involved the thrashing of a toll worker who asked for identification from the occupants of the MLA's vehicle.

articles.headline: Telangana High Court grants bail to top Maoist leader after 16 years
articles.summary: Amitabh Bagchi, a 74-year-old member of the banned CPI (Maoist), was released from jail after 16 years. The court ruled that the sessions court had erroneously cancelled his bail without supervening circumstances.

articles.headline: Supreme Court rules women inmates have fundamental right to open prisons
articles.summary: In a significant 138-page judgment, the Supreme Court ruled that excluding women from open correctional institutions is unconstitutional. The court mandated the transformation of prisons into reformative centers that allow family access.

articles.headline: Dark web trail leads to death sentence for UP couple in abuse case
articles.summary: A special court in Banda has sentenced a couple to death for the decade-long sexual abuse of 33 boys in Chitrakoot. The crimes were uncovered after Belgian police flagged child abuse material on the dark web.

articles.headline: Kerala government challenges acquittal of actor Dileep in assault case
articles.summary: The Kerala government has moved the High Court to challenge the acquittal of actor Dileep in the 2017 actress assault case. The state is also seeking stricter punishments for six other men convicted in the case.

articles.headline: Pakistan knocked out of World Cup despite win over Lanka
articles.summary: Pakistan failed to reach the T20 World Cup semi-finals as New Zealand advanced on a better net run rate. Despite a stunning century by Sahibzada Farhan, Pakistan could not restrict Sri Lanka enough to qualify.

articles.headline: The emotional legacy and historical disgrace of Eden Gardens
articles.summary: A retrospective on the highs and lows of Kolkata's iconic cricket stadium, from historical triumphs to the infamous 1996 World Cup semi-final. The venue remains a symbol of deep passion and occasional controversy in Indian cricket.

articles.headline: Owais Manhas details J&K’s structural path to Ranji success
articles.summary: Interview with J&K's development head reveals the extensive infrastructure and coaching changes that led to their first Ranji title. The team transitioned from perennial underdogs to champions through professional management and improved facilities.

articles.headline: Norwegian Underdogs Bodo/Glimt Slay European Elites in Champions League
articles.summary: Bodo/Glimt, a team from a small town above the Arctic Circle, defeated Inter Milan to advance in the Champions League playoffs. They are the first team outside Europe's top five leagues to win four consecutive games against elite clubs since 1972.

articles.headline: IFAB Approves New Rules to Speed Up Matches for 2026 World Cup
articles.summary: The International Football Association Board has approved a five-second visual countdown for throw-ins and goal kicks to prevent time-wasting. These measures will be implemented globally and at the 2026 World Cup to increase active playing time.

articles.headline: Lovlina Borgohain and Nikhat Zareen to Lead Indian Boxing Contingent
articles.summary: Olympic medalist Lovlina Borgohain and Nikhat Zareen headline a 20-member Indian squad for the Asian Boxing Championships in Mongolia. The tournament is a critical qualification pathway for upcoming multi-sport events like the Commonwealth Games.

articles.headline: FIFA Monitors Middle East Tensions as 2026 World Cup Approaches
articles.summary: FIFA is closely tracking military developments in Iran following US strikes, as the nation is scheduled to play in Group G of the upcoming World Cup. Matches for the tournament are set to take place in the US, Canada, and Mexico.

articles.headline: HC stays Delhi notification on school fee committee constitution
articles.summary: The Delhi High Court stayed a notification by the Directorate of Education regarding the formation of school fee committees. The court observed that the stipulated timelines were too tight for schools to process applications.

articles.headline: RGNUL Patiala academic council proposes dropping Rajiv Gandhi from name
articles.summary: The academic council of RGNUL has recommended renaming the institution to National Law University, Punjab. The proposal must now be approved by the university's Executive Council and requires a legislative amendment.

articles.headline: Over five lakh students appear for Pre-University examinations in Karnataka
articles.summary: The state-level PU examinations commenced on Saturday with a 97% attendance rate across Karnataka. No cases of malpractice were reported during the first day, which featured Kannada and Arabic language papers.

articles.headline: No primary government school should be closed says writer Baraguru Ramachandrappa
articles.summary: Speaking at a state-level educational convention, writer Baraguru Ramachandrappa stated that primary schools represent the foundation of education and should never face closure. The government promised to address teacher promotion and pension issues.

articles.headline: Recruitment delays impact coaching hubs and job aspirants in Dharwad
articles.summary: Saptapur, North Karnataka's competitive exam coaching hub, is seeing a decline in student enrollment due to delays in state government recruitment. Many institutes are shifting focus toward central government jobs to remain viable.

articles.headline: US government ends ties with Anthropic after safety dispute
articles.summary: The Trump administration ordered US agencies to stop using Anthropic’s AI technology following a public clash over safety and military usage. OpenAI has subsequently agreed to supply its AI models to the US Defense Department.

articles.headline: Analysis of potential GenAI market bubble and economic risks
articles.summary: Experts warn that while Generative AI is transformative, current equity valuations may be stretched beyond fundamentals. A potential market correction could impact global banking and consumer spending in the short term.

articles.headline: AI adoption by US firms jumps to 78 percent in 2024
articles.summary: A new study indicates a sharp rise in artificial intelligence usage among American companies, jumping from 55% to 78% in one year. Goods and services firms saw their AI usage double during the same period.

articles.headline: OpenAI strikes deal for Pentagon to use AI models in military networks
articles.summary: OpenAI has reached an agreement to supply AI technology for classified US defense agency use. The deal includes specific safeguards regarding the autonomous use of force and military-grade applications.

articles.headline: Prime Minister Modi Inaugurates Micron’s ₹22,500-Crore Semiconductor Facility in Gujarat
articles.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched Micron Technology’s new assembly and testing facility in Sanand, Gujarat. This is the first of ten projects under the India Semiconductor Mission to begin commercial production, aiming to meet global demand for memory and storage.

articles.headline: Pharma Giant MSD Uses AI to Double Molecules Under Development
articles.summary: MSD’s Chief AI Officer Anton Groom stated that the company is deploying AI models like TEDDY to accelerate drug discovery. The technology has helped double the number of molecules in their pipeline while maintaining a 'human-in-the-loop' approach for safety.

articles.headline: Gen Z Drives Resurgence of Retro Tech and Wired Earphones
articles.summary: Younger consumers are moving back to tactile technology, including flip phones, wired earphones, and Casio digital watches, to combat digital fatigue. Retailers report a triple-digit spike in sales for CD players and point-and-shoot cameras.

articles.headline: War engulfs West Asia as US and Israel strike Iran
articles.summary: The US and Israel launched major strikes against Iran, targeting military leaders and infrastructure in response to previous missile attacks. President Donald Trump urged the Iranian people to rise up against their leadership.

articles.headline: India calls for restraint and dialogue following West Asia strikes
articles.summary: External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar spoke with counterparts in Iran, Israel, and the UAE to express concern over military escalations. India has urged all parties to prioritize diplomacy and protect the safety of civilians.

articles.headline: High alert in J&K and Ladakh after US-Iran conflict escalation
articles.summary: Security has been ramped up in Jammu, Kashmir, and Ladakh to maintain peace following the joint US-Israel strikes on Iran. Peaceful protests occurred in several Shia-dominated areas of the Kashmir Valley against the attacks.

articles.headline: France to confer top civilian honour on diplomat Jawed Ashraf
articles.summary: Former Indian envoy Jawed Ashraf will be awarded the 'Commander of the Legion of Honour' by the French government. The ceremony in March will recognize his contributions during his tenure as Ambassador to France.

articles.headline: Khamenei's relatives killed in US-Israel strikes on Tehran
articles.summary: The son-in-law and daughter-in-law of Iran's Supreme Leader were reportedly killed in recent military strikes. Iran has vowed to retaliate, declaring US and Israeli bases in the region as legitimate military targets.

articles.headline: Global alarm as nations call for restraint in Middle East
articles.summary: China, Saudi Arabia, and several European nations have expressed strong condemnation of the military escalation in Iran. World leaders warned that the conflict could have devastating consequences for international security and peace.

articles.headline: US and Israel launch major strikes on Iran in Operation Epic Fury
articles.summary: The United States and Israel launched a massive coordinated attack on Iranian military and nuclear facilities on Saturday. Iran retaliated with missiles and drones targeting US bases in the Gulf and Israel, as President Trump called for the overthrow of the Iranian government.

articles.headline: Airstrikes hit girls’ school in southern Iran killing 85 students
articles.summary: At least 85 people were killed and 68 others injured after a girls' school was struck in the Iranian town of Minab. Iranian officials blamed the attack on US and Israeli forces involved in the ongoing military campaign.

articles.headline: Nearly 900 flights cancelled as West Asia airspace closes due to strikes
articles.summary: Large swathes of Middle East airspace were shut down on Saturday, grounding hundreds of flights and leaving thousands of passengers stranded. Indian carriers have suspended all flights to the region through March 2.

articles.headline: US and Israel Strike Iran in Joint Operation Targeting Top Leaders
articles.summary: The United States and Israel launched a joint military operation against Iran targeting strategic defense systems and government officials. President Donald Trump stated the strikes aimed to eliminate nuclear threats, while Tehran retaliated with missiles aimed at US bases and Gulf allies.

articles.headline: Loud Explosions Rock UAE as Iranian Missiles Target Dubai and Abu Dhabi
articles.summary: The United Arab Emirates experienced direct missile strikes on Saturday, causing loud explosions and debris falls in Dubai and Abu Dhabi. Authorities shut down airspace and issued safety advisories as the region's traditional safe haven faced its first direct military targeting in decades.

articles.headline: Tajikistan Rapidly Modernizes Architecture to Emerge from Soviet Shadows
articles.summary: The Central Asian nation of Tajikistan is undergoing a construction frenzy, highlighted by the 121-metre Istiklol tower in Dushanbe. The country is attempting to redefine its national identity and culture following decades of Soviet influence.

articles.headline: Strait of Hormuz shut down as shipping lane risks grow
articles.summary: The critical Strait of Hormuz has been effectively closed following US-Israel strikes on Iran, threatening global oil and trade routes. This closure is expected to severely impact global energy supplies and spike international crude prices.

articles.headline: Middle East air travel disrupted; thousands of Indians stranded
articles.summary: Several nations including the UAE, Qatar, and Kuwait closed their airspace on Saturday following military escalations. The shutdown has left thousands of Indian travelers stranded at major transit hubs like Dubai and Doha.

articles.headline: Telangana government to enact new Core Urban Act for Hyderabad
articles.summary: Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy announced plans for the 'Hyderabad Core Urban Act' to replace the existing GHMC Act. The legislation aims to provide a comprehensive administration for three municipal corporations in the capital region.

articles.headline: Fading zebra crossings spark safety concerns for pedestrians across Bengaluru
articles.summary: Pedestrians in Bengaluru are struggling as zebra markings have vanished or been buried under recent asphalt patchwork. Residents and traffic police noted that the lack of visible markings significantly increases hazards for children and the elderly.

articles.headline: South Western Railway announces single trip special train from Bengaluru to Mumbai
articles.summary: In response to passenger demand for the Holi festival, a non-air-conditioned express train will run from Bengaluru to Mumbai on Sunday. SWR officials noted the service is an alternative to the crowded Udyan Express.

articles.headline: PM Modi inaugurates India’s first semiconductor assembly plant in Sanand
articles.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the Micron Technology chip plant in Gujarat, calling it a milestone for India’s hardware sector. He emphasized that the facility makes India a reliable partner in the global semiconductor supply chain.

articles.headline: Indian Airlines Suspend West Asia Operations Leaving Thousands of Passengers Stranded
articles.summary: Air India, IndiGo, and other Indian carriers cancelled at least 170 flights on Saturday due to airspace closures across the Gulf. The Directorate General of Civil Aviation has marked 11 airspaces in the region as high-risk zones.

articles.headline: Villagers build memorial and statue for prized bull in Tiruchirappalli
articles.summary: Residents of Tiruverumbur have constructed a memorial and installed a lifelike statue for a beloved bull named Senkurichi. The statue serves as a tribute to the animal's legacy in the local community.

articles.headline: TTD approves annual budget of over 25,000 crore for FY27
articles.summary: The Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams approved a budget of ₹25,456.25 crore, expecting high revenue from hundi collections and interest. Major allocations include ₹89 crore for educational institutions and ₹1,700 crore for engineering works.

articles.headline: Mona Singh on breaking stereotypes and reinventing her acting career
articles.summary: Actor Mona Singh discusses her transition from unglamorous television roles to playing complex characters in streaming series like 'Kohhra'. She emphasizes the importance of taking risks and prioritizing character depth over on-screen glamour.

articles.headline: Historical journey and cultural significance of Bengal's mishti
articles.summary: A new book explores the evolution of Bengali sweets, tracing their roots through colonial influence and local traditions. It highlights how sweets like the rosogolla have become integral to the region's rituals and social status.

articles.headline: Legacy of Amrita Pritam: A life lived on her terms
articles.summary: This feature reflects on the steel spirit of poet Amrita Pritam, known for her defiance and iconic literary works. Despite social slander, she remained a powerful voice for independence and emotional honesty.

articles.headline: MP Sudha Murty urges public to show compassion toward street dogs
articles.summary: Philanthropist and Rajya Sabha MP Sudha Murty called for the regular feeding of street dogs, emphasizing the concept of Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam. She shared personal stories about her pet dog and encouraged humane treatment of strays.

articles.headline: Manipuri film Boong makes history with first Indian win at BAFTA Awards
articles.summary: Lakshmipriya Devi's debut film 'Boong' has won the BAFTA for Best Children's and Family Film. The story follows a Manipuri schoolboy searching for his missing father amidst regional racial tensions.

articles.headline: Legendary singer-songwriter Neil Sedaka dies at age 86
articles.summary: Neil Sedaka, the iconic musician known for hits like 'Breaking Up Is Hard to Do,' passed away on Friday. He was a prominent figure in the early rock'n'roll era and enjoyed a major resurgence in the 1970s.

articles.headline: Sangeetha files for divorce from actor-politician Vijay citing mental cruelty
articles.summary: Sangeetha, the wife of Tamil actor and politician Vijay, has filed for divorce, alleging prolonged mental cruelty and extramarital relationships. The filing has sparked significant media interest regarding the couple's long-standing marriage.

articles.headline: India’s Museum Landscape Shifts Toward Experience-Led and Private-Funded Models
articles.summary: A major modernization effort is transforming Indian museums, including the upcoming Yuge Yugeen Bharat Museum in Delhi. Private initiatives like the Param Science Experience Centre are using interactive technology to redefine how citizens engage with science and culture.

articles.headline: New Los Angeles Exhibition Immerses Visitors in Miyazaki’s Ponyo World
articles.summary: The Academy Museum of Motion Pictures has dedicated a 350-square-metre interactive exhibit to the hand-drawn 2008 classic Ponyo. The display features original sketches and installations designed to teach children about traditional animation techniques.

articles.headline: Bad Bunny Performance Sparks Global Interest in Salsa Dancing for Youth
articles.summary: A surge in salsa dancing has been reported globally following musician Bad Bunny’s incorporation of the genre in his Super Bowl performance. Dance teachers report that the 'Bad Bunny Effect' is bringing a new generation to traditional partner dancing.

articles.headline: Centre temporarily suspends iron-fortified rice supply in nutrition schemes
articles.summary: The central government has suspended the supply of iron-fortified rice following reports of nutrient degradation during storage. Health experts have raised concerns about the potential toxicity and safety of the fortified grains.

articles.headline: Growing global momentum for social media bans for minors
articles.summary: Social psychologists and governments are increasingly debating age-related restrictions on social media to protect youth mental health. Recent research highlights links between early smartphone use and increased vulnerability to abuse and addiction.

articles.headline: UP woman seeks government assistance after failed sterilization leads to birth
articles.summary: A 27-year-old woman in Uttar Pradesh’s Jalaun district has requested government support to raise her child after a tubectomy procedure failed. Health officials have launched an investigation into potential medical negligence.

articles.headline: Workplace stress and AI fears driving presenteeism among professionals in Bengaluru
articles.summary: Mental health experts in Bengaluru have highlighted a trend of employees showing up for work despite being unwell due to fear of job loss. Factors include recent layoffs and anxiety surrounding AI-driven task automation.

articles.headline: Pharmaceutical distributors in Karnataka oppose mandatory batchwise drug certificates
articles.summary: A government order requiring wholesalers to obtain batch-wise certificates for every drug purchase has met with opposition from pharmacy associations. Distributors argue the directive is impractical and could disrupt the critical medicine supply chain.

articles.headline: Karnataka health minister orders monitoring of IVF centres following egg racket
articles.summary: Health Minister Dinesh Gundu Rao has directed officials to monitor Bengaluru's IVF centers after an illegal egg trafficking racket was uncovered in Maharashtra. Investigations are exploring potential links between the racket and local clinics.

articles.headline: Telangana student gives birth to stillborn during examination, returns to write
articles.summary: A 16-year-old student at a government college in Telangana gave birth to a stillborn baby in the washroom during an exam. Despite the event, she returned to the exam hall to complete her paper before being hospitalized.

articles.headline: Space manufacturing emerges as new frontier for private companies
articles.summary: Microgravity is unlocking breakthroughs in printing artificial tissues and creating advanced semiconductor materials on the ISS. Scientists are also working on using lunar soil to build infrastructure for future moon habitations.

articles.headline: Study finds human brain can grow new neurons well into the 80s
articles.summary: Research published in Nature provides evidence that the adult brain continues to generate new neurons in the memory center throughout life. This process of neurogenesis is significantly disrupted by the onset of Alzheimer's disease.

articles.headline: Scientists Reveal How Horses Produce Complex Two-Toned Whinnies
articles.summary: A study using high-speed cameras has discovered that a horse's whinny is composed of two different fundamental frequencies produced simultaneously in the voice box. This unique mechanism may allow horses to convey multiple emotional messages at once.

articles.headline: Massive explosion at Andhra Pradesh firecracker unit kills 20 people
articles.summary: A massive blast at Surya Shakti Fireworks in Andhra Pradesh's Kakinada district killed 20 people and left at least 11 others critically injured. Most of the deceased were daily wage workers, including nine women, according to state officials. Authorities suspect the unit had stockpiled chemicals far beyond permissible limits, leading to the devastating explosion.

articles.headline: Three men suffocate to death while cleaning water sump in Whitefield
articles.summary: Three men, including a homeowner and a plumber, died of suspected asphyxiation while cleaning an unused water sump in Whitefield, Bengaluru. The victims reportedly collapsed after inhaling toxic fumes inside the confined space during the attempt on Saturday. A police officer using an oxygen mask eventually recovered the bodies from the structure.

articles.headline: West Bengal Electorate Drops by Six Million Following Voter List Revision
articles.summary: The Election Commission of India's special revision in West Bengal has resulted in the deletion of approximately 6.2 million names from the voter list. This reduction brings the state's total electorate to 70.4 million, according to Chief Electoral Officer Manoj Kumar Agarwal. Additionally, another six million entries have been marked for judicial adjudication due to logical discrepancies.

articles.headline: Congress and DMK remain deadlocked over seat sharing for upcoming polls
articles.summary: Seat-sharing negotiations between the DMK and Congress for the upcoming Tamil Nadu assembly polls ended without resolution on Saturday. While DMK leaders described the talks as friendly, Congress is reportedly demanding 41 seats while the DMK has offered only 25 seats and one Rajya Sabha berth. Congress leaders remain hopeful that their specific requirements for seat allocations will eventually be met.

articles.headline: Jammu and Kashmir Create History by Winning Maiden Ranji Trophy Title
articles.summary: Jammu and Kashmir secured their first-ever Ranji Trophy title by defeating eight-time champions Karnataka in Hubballi, ending a 67-year wait. The historic victory, highlighted by pacer Auqib Nabi's record-breaking season, sparked widespread celebrations across Srinagar and Jammu. Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated the team for their remarkable grit and historic triumph.

articles.headline: India Faces Must-Win Clash Against West Indies for T20 Semifinal Spot
articles.summary: The Indian men's cricket team faces a critical must-win T20 World Cup clash against the West Indies tonight at Eden Gardens in Kolkata. To secure a semifinal spot, coaches are emphasizing a fearless batting approach to counter the West Indies' high-intensity playstyle. Spinner Varun Chakravarthy is expected to be a key factor for the Indian side playing on his home ground.

articles.headline: Over 300 killed in overnight border clashes between Pakistan and Afghanistan
articles.summary: Pakistani forces carried out military strikes deep inside Afghanistan, targeting installations and claiming to have killed over 300 Afghan forces. Islamabad stated the escalation was a response to an earlier Afghan cross-border attack that prompted a massive military reaction. However, Afghanistan has rejected the casualty figures and alleged that civilian areas were targeted in the strikes.
